info.title: Digitex Rest Trading API
info.description:
Digitex's REST trading api specification

In order to start, one has to register either at https://testnet.digitexfutures.com for testnet (virtual funds trading) or at https://digitex.io - our mainnet (real money trading). After registration you need to obtain your trading token in your account. Direct links to the account page: - testnet - https://testnet.digitexfutures.com/profile/account - mainet - https://digitex.io/trade/profile/account If you have already created your token, you can simply copy it, else click on "Create" in the API section of your account. IMPORTANT NOTES! - All of the data which is expected to be float or decimal are passed as strings. Data is converted into Decimal/float format on the client level - All timestamps are in nanoseconds UTC - Enums, such as order types, status etc can be found in Exchange-Meta-Data group of endpoints

get.description: Returns list of currencies that are available to use in the wallet

parameters.name: currency_id
parameters.description: Optional query parameter to return single currency info, if empty returns list of available currencies

/v1/exchange/bot/ping.summary: Utility endpoint to ping the server, If "pong" is in the response, then the service is working properly. Additionally there is a timestamp value of servers's internal time. Note all times are in UTC
/v1/exchange/bot/ping.description: Utility endpoint to ping the server, If "pong" is in the response, then the service is working properly. Additionally there is a timestamp value of servers's internal time. Note all times are in UTC

get.description: Utility endpoint to ping the server, If "pong" is in the response, then the service is working properly. Additionally there is a timestamp value of servers's internal time. Note all times are in UTC

/v1/exchange/bot/order_book/.summary: Returns order book for the market

get.description: Returns exchange's order book for selected market

parameters.name: max_trades
parameters.description: Limit maximum number of recent trades. Default limit is 1000

get.summary: List of recent trades done at the market

parameters.name: max_trades
parameters.description: limits the amount of max trades. if not specified the trades are limited by the last 60 minutes

/v1/exchange/bot/history/ohlcv/.summary: View for OHLCV (open-high-low-close chart) candles with selected by datetime
/v1/exchange/bot/history/ohlcv/.description: View for OHLCV (open-high-low-close chart) candles with selected by datetime

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including from.

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including to. It can be in the future. In this case, the rightmost required bar is the latest available bar.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are daily (D or 1D, 2D ... ), weekly (1W, 2W ...), monthly (1M, 2M...) and an intra-day resolution – minutes(1, 2 ...).

get.description:
Returns open high low close volume aggregated data for selected market and timeframe.

In any case returns max 1k datapoints. Optionally datapoints can be filtered with date_from and date_to parameters

Available timeframes (resolutions):
- daily (D or 1D, 2D ... )
- weekly (1W, 2W ...)
- monthly (1M, 2M...)
- minutes (1, 2 ...).

/v1/exchange/bot/exchange_info/.summary: Get exchange info. This endpoint returns all metadata for the exchange.

get.description:
This endpoint returns all metadata for the exchange, such as:
- traders ratelimits. сurrently this is not strictly enforced, however rate limits can be applied individually if the trader abuses the API
- notifications. This field will contain all notifications/announcements from the exchnage. Please note, these are not system notifications. 
- servertime - server's Unix timestamp in microseconds.
- currencies
- markets
- order types enum values (LIMIT/MARKET)
- time in force / order duruation enum values (e.g Good till funding, Good till cancelled)
- order_sides enum values (But/Sell)
- order_positions enum values(Long/Short)
- order_status (Pending, Accepted, Filled, etc)

parameters.name: market_id
parameters.description: Optional query to return just one market_id

/v1/exchange/bot/order_history/.description:
Includes orders that are no longer active. These are orders that have the following status:
- FILLED - numerical status 5. Order has been fully filled
- CANCELLED - numerical status 4. Order has been cancelled by user. Note partially filled order can be cancelled as well
- REJECTED - numerical status 3. Order has been rejected by matching engine.

All query parameters are optional.

parameters.name: created_at_from
parameters.description: Timestamp in nanoseconds. Filters for order created at or after this timestamp

parameters.name: created_at_to
parameters.description: Timestamp in nanoseconds. Filters for orders created before this timestamp

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Amount of order displayed per page

get.description:
Includes orders that are no longer active. These are orders that have the following status:
- FILLED - numerical status 5. Order has been fully filled
- CANCELLED - numerical status 4. Order has been cancelled by user. Note partially filled order can be cancelled as well
- REJECTED - numerical status 3. Order has been rejected by matching engine.

All query parameters are optional.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Amount of order displayed per page

parameters.name: created_at_to
parameters.description: Timestamp in nanoseconds. Filters for orders created before this timestamp

parameters.name: created_at_from
parameters.description: Timestamp in nanoseconds. Filters for order created at or after this timestamp

/v1/exchange/bot/order_status/.description: Get status of orders by query params

parameters.name: trader_id
parameters.description: optional trader's id. Works in case user has several trading accounts

get.description: Get status of orders by query params

parameters.name: trader_id
parameters.description: optional trader's id. Works in case user has several trading accounts

/v1/exchange/bot/orders/.description:
Open orders are orders that have not been fully filled yet.

These are order with order_status:
- PENDING - numerical status 1 - the order has been recieved, however not yet accepted by the exchange matching engine
- ACCEPTED - numerical status 2 - the order has been recieved, validated and accepted by the exchange matching engine
- PARTIAL - numerical status 6 - ACCEPTED + partially filled. Partial filled information and remaining volume are part of the open order information


Orders can be filtered with any of the query parameters. No query parameters mean all open orders.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
- ACCEPTED (2) - order has been accepted for execution by matching engine
- PENDING (1) - order has been recieved, however not yet accepted
- PARTIAL (6) - order has been only partially filled

get.description:
Open orders are orders that have not been fully filled yet.

These are order with order_status:
- PENDING - numerical status 1 - the order has been recieved, however not yet accepted by the exchange matching engine
- ACCEPTED - numerical status 2 - the order has been recieved, validated and accepted by the exchange matching engine
- PARTIAL - numerical status 6 - ACCEPTED + partially filled. Partial filled information and remaining volume are part of the open order information


Orders can be filtered with any of the query parameters. No query parameters means all open orders.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
- ACCEPTED (2) - order has been accepted for execution by matching engine
- PENDING (1) - order has been recieved, however not yet accepted
- PARTIAL (6) - order has been only partially filled

/v1/exchange/bot/trade_history/.description: Get trade history of a trader

parameters.name: traded_at_to
parameters.description: Timestamp in nanoseconds. Only return contracts traded before this time.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for fetching pages in pagination

get.description: Get trade history of a trader

parameters.name: traded_at_to
parameters.description: timestamp in nanoseconds. Only return contracts traded before this time.

parameters.name: traded_at_from
parameters.description: timestamp in nanoseconds. Only return contracts traded after this time.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for fetching pages in pagination

requestBody.description:
to cancel an order(s) - send list of cliet_id(s)

to cancel all order(s) by market - send only market_id

to cancel all orders - send empty body

/v1/exchange/bot/position/.description: Shows current position of the trader in the futures market

200.description: Returns user's current balances of main and trading account. Does not show user's available balance

duration.description:
UNDEFINED - 0
GTD - 1
GTC - 2
GTF - 3
IOC - 4
FOK - 5

quantity.description:
Quantity of the order. For futures - this is amount of contracts traded.
If spot and order side is Buy (side=1) - amount of quote currency
If spot and order side is Sell (side=2) - amount of base currency

market_id.description: market id, can be found in markets instance

duration.description:
duration of the order
    
    UNDEFINED = 0
    GFD = 1
    GTC = 2
    GTF = 3
    IOC = 4
    FOK = 5

leverage.description: Leverage of the trades, only valid for futures market and will be ignored for spot

quantity.description:
quantity of the order. If you are trading futures, this is - amount of contracts.

for spot - it depends on your side.

client_id.description: user generated uidid. it is optional, the backend will generate one if nothing is provided

notifications.description: List of recent notifications that can affect your trading experience.

rate_limits.description: User's currently enforced rate limits. Not implemented yet

order_meta.description:
Order meta params from:
Order type
Order duration
Order side
Order position
Order status

timestamp.description: unix timestamp in nanoseconds. Note, all times here and in the rest of project are in nanoseconds

currency_scale.description: Currency scale - number of decimal points used in market quotes

withdraw_fee.description: The flat fee Digitex exchange charges a user for on chain withdrawal via its Withdrawal service

PositionItem.title: Root Type for PositionResponseItem
PositionItem.description: Model for trader's position. Works only with futures

quantity.description: Quantity of the contracts in the position

contract_currency.description: Contract currency id of the position

mark_price.description: Current mark price, price which used used to trigger liquidations

main_balance.description: Current Main account balance for given currency

trading_balance.description: Currenct Trading account balance for given currency

available_balance.description: Available balance to the trader after taking into account all the margins

total_balance.description: Total available balace (main account + trading account) does not take into consideration margin

RateLimits.description: Rate limits are not implemented yet but will be implemented in the future, once the exchange hits it reasonable total requests limit

id.description: Interal market id, is used for trading

base_currency.description: Base currency of the spot market or undrelying base currency of the futures contract

quote_currency.description: Quote currency of the spot market or underlying quote currency of the futures contract

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating start of the period
timestamp of the order in nanoseconds

base_volume.description: If spot - base volume of currency. If fututes - number of contracts.

quote_volume.description: If spot - amount of quote currency. If futures - "notional" amount - (base_volume/quantity of contracts) * price

price.description: Price at which trade was executed

trade_id.description: internal trade id, used only to differentiate orders if they traded at the same nanosecod

bids.description: Array of [bid price[str], volume[str]] pairs, volume is either contract volume or volume of base currency if spot

asks.description: Array of [ask price[str], volume[str]] pairs, volume is either contract volume or volume of base currency if spot

OrderDuration.description:
Duration of the order
    
    UNDEFINED - 0
    GFD - 1
    GTC - 2
    GTF - 3
    IOC - 4
    FOK - 5

OrderStatus.description:
Order statuses
    
    PENDING - 1
    ACCEPTED - 2
    REJECTED - 3
    CANCELED - 4
    FILLED - 5
    PARTIAL - 6

OrderMeta.description:
Order meta params from:
Order type
Order duration
Order side
Order position
Ordet status

order_duration.description:
UNDEFINED - 0
    GTD - 1
    GTC - 2
    GTF - 3
    IOC - 4
    FOK - 5

order_status.description:
PENDING - 1
    ACCEPTED - 2
    REJECTED - 3
    CANCELED - 4
    FILLED - 5
    PARTIAL - 6

TradersToken.description:
Trader's token should be place in the header of the request, e.g.:
{"Authorization": "Token 4321532asfasdf31453245234adsadsf"}
TradersToken.name: Authorization
